summary: Protection l Chapter five: Crusin' for a bruisn'
body:
Protection l Chapter five: Crusin’ for a bruisn’

Summary: 

After the door incident which leaves you a mark on your head, you are now forced to leave somewhere you had most of your best memories from

Warning(s): Bruises and Police

Author notes:

Hello! yeah, I know it’s been a while, like a good 8 months for exact since I uploaded this. Long story short, home, school, personal like, writer’s block, family, and school been getting to me, and also I’ll be graduating from HS in two months. I have a TON on my plate. Also, I have to finish up a 500-word essay and a powerpoint and then I’m Done!

But yeah that’s pretty much me at the moment. How are ya’ll?

———————————————————————————————

Warmth.

The AC was on. You were lying on your white carpet floor, remembering a gun being pointed at you and hard banging on the door. Believing it was just You went to stand up but stopped as you saw small red splatter stains on your carpet, confused you looked behind you as and a trail towards your front door.

You felt a cold chill crawl down your back.

Body froze as you soon realize that was blood, and that entire ordeal was real, Your insides were quivering as you almost threw up from the fear. You quickly gathered yourself up and raced into your room,  slamming the door and locking it. You searched desperately for your phone as sickness and fear were building up.

You find it and dial 9-1-1.

——————————————-

Before your father had given your life into the BoogeyMan’s claws, he had set some strict rules for the beast.

Rule number one he had broken almost immediately as you had a gun pointed at you.

Rule number two: Protect.

John did a pretty decent job of that since it wasn’t entirely his fault that the men found out where you lived and got in your home.

Rule number three: All eyes on Y/N

Broken.

John had left you alone.

There were a few more rules set for John but had gotten distracted by the five cop cars, an ambulance, firetruck, and a group of people surrounding your home.

“Y/N”, John muttered.

From where John was standing the situation looked worst or much Fatal for you. By passing through concern neighbors, he could see some cops entering the home His heart pounding in his chest he reached the yellow tape, which was being guarded by two cops.

Almost out of breath, John asked about what had happened inside the home. He was Ignored.

Not caring,  John lifted up the yellow tape and tried entering the scene.

“Sir! Stepped back, you can’t come through!”, one said and the other putting a hand on John’s chest

—————————————————-

Five cops hounded your home.

Two talking to you and three looking around your home for any evidence, you were sitting on your couch with an ice bag placed on the side of your head, grateful not to be to seriously hurt.

“Are you sure you didn’t know the men who came in your home? Have you seen them around here before? Heard of them from neighbors?” an officer questioned.

“Positive”, you responded.

They don’t even look like they would live around this neighborhood as they were wearing completely black clothing in a highly colorful populated area.

You bit your bottom lip as a strike of pain hit your brain, you tried not to think so much.

“And when you heard the banging, you suddenly saw black and woke up in your home on the floor?”

“Ye-yeah, I mean I saw them but then it went to black”, the darkness was probably when they had hit you before John busted in.

Speaking of him, where was the Assassin? For a mild second, you did hope he was okay, but that sweet Thoughts soon changed as you remember they were looking for John, the ‘Baba Yaga’. Bastard.

“Sir! Wait you can’t come in here-!” A female cop spoke as a man wearing just black was pushing through. It was John. Your heartbeat at the sight of him, but you quickly remember that the man put you in this situation.

“Y/N!”, John called pushing through pushing aside the speaking officer. “Y/N! Are you okay?” He came closer, walking more in the room. You noticed the look of concern on his face. He looked a little beaten up on the outside but gave worried eyes to you. There was no way he was…did he.?

Before he could reach you he was stopped by three officers.

“Sir we’re just gonna need you to step outside for a minute so we can handle the situation”, one said, while the others stood in his way.

“Wait-wait!”, you shouted at the door. A little bit of you regretted the words that were about to come out your mouth but, “he’s, I-I know him..”, a wave of regret immdentatly hit you as you watched the officers agree with one another and let go of John.

You sighed as he stopped in front of you. Looking up with regretful eyes with some airiness with them, “John, uh hey-”.

“How are you head?” he asked bending a knee, analyzing your face.

“What?”, wow and just like the wave of regret hit you soon the wave of, ‘Holy sh#t maybe he isn’t a cold-blooded assassin after all’, but you quickly tamed that feeling.

His hand laid on top of yours where you held the ice bag, face feeling hot as he’s large hands curled in yours. He slightly moved the bag to see the forming bruise on your head, you winced from the brush. It was red and purple, it was gonna take a few days for it to heal.

“Are you hurt anywhere else?” he asked, his eyes connecting with yours. you noticed something about his eyes, actually two things. 1. They were pretty brown and 2. that there was a form of relief and happiness in them. Maybe upon seeing you again, and that you were safe.

“N-no I’m fine, are you?”, only excuse asking that was he had visible markings on himself which looks somewhat worse than your bruise.

He took a deep sigh, pushing some strays of his hair back.

“If your fine, then I’m fine”, he smiled taking a seat next to you.

A hot feeling came to your back and neck,  then soon to your face. You lowered your eyes downward as you realized you were staring at the man’s face for too long. You had to admit it again, John was handsome..for an assassin.

—————————————————

After two hours, the crowd of neighbors was then gone and most of the police cars were also. leaving you and John alone again. He was silent the whole time sitting in a chair, even after the cops left he was still sitting there, he was probably thinking. While he was doing that you were checking around your house hoping none of your personal items were missing, or any family pictures.

“Y/N, do you have any empty pieces of baggage set up?”, John checked his watch, it was passed at 8 pm.

“uh, yeah. why?”, you looked behind a picture frame.

“where’s your room?” He asked again.

You gave a long pause to him,“…W-why? What’s in my room?”, you said.

John adjusts himself in the chair, slumping forward with both hands intertwined. “After what happened today, and my negligence to protect you..”

“And the big ass bruise that is on my head now”, you added jokily.

“Yes that too. I believe it would be best for us to leave here and more to a better location..”.

“what?”, you looked at him.

“You need to start packing, now. It’s not safe here for any more”. He stood up going down your hallway and into your closed room. “Hey wait! w-what are you talking about?! John!”, you chased after the man.

“John! What do you mean, move to a better location?”, you watched as John opened your closet door to grab your empty luggage. “Exactly what I said. We’re leaving, Y/N”.

It almost was like you heard your heart shatter into millions of pieces, sadness was beginning to set in. You had lived here for a few years made some good friends, neighbors and you were even close to some childhood friends just a few blocks away and now that’s changing because of one incident-an incident that you caused- is now affecting you personally. Once again.

After pulling out the last luggage from the closet he turned and said, “Just give it a few more days, maybe some weeks, and then we’ll see..”, as he thought he was being listened to, nothing was there. You weren’t there.

He turned, “Y/n?”.

You were gone.

“what?”, you looked at him.

“You need to start packing, now. It’s not safe here for any more”. He stood up going down your hallway and into your closed room. “Hey wait! w-what are you talking about?! John!”, you chased after the man.

“John! What do you mean, move to a better location?”, you watched as John opened your closet door to grab your empty luggage. “Exactly what I said. We’re leaving, Y/N”.

It almost was like you heard your heart shatter into millions of pieces, sadness was beginning to set in. You had lived here for a few years made some good friends, neighbors and you were even close to some childhood friends just a few blocks away and now that’s changing because of one incident-an incident that you caused- is now affecting you personally. Once again.

After pulling out the last luggage from the closet he turned and said, “Just give it a few more days, maybe some weeks, and then we’ll see..”, as he thought he was being listened to, nothing was there. You weren’t there.

He turned, “Y/n?”.

You were gone.

blog.name: angelofberlin2000
blog.title: Like a Rose trampled on the ground
blog.description:
In addition to the pain and the exhaustion, he recalled how waiting on the cross between takes became tedious. To fight the boredom, he listened to music on headphones. One particular song called "Above All" (Like a Rose ...) by Michael W. Smith helped him through his most difficult moments.

"It arrived when I was confused and angry. I didn't think I could go on. The song described how Jesus was rejected and alone. That thought took me to a place — it opened an interior door that held me while on the cross," an emotional Caviezel explained. "The experience of feeling rejected and alone as all those around me laughed while drinking their hot coffees, oblivious to what was occurring. Jesus must have felt like this — forsaken, rejected, alone, and despised. It helped me pray in a very deep way — to pray without words, to pray from the heart. The discomfort, the loneliness, the split shoulder, the raw flesh all forced me into the arms of God because I had nowhere else to go for a performance I knew I was unable to create."
Jim Caviezel, Shamelessly Catholic

summary: Keanu Reeves’ Replicas is coming to Blu-ray & DVD next month
title: Keanu Reeves’ Replicas is coming to Blu-ray & DVD next month
excerpt: Offering a fresh take on the Frankenstein myth, Replicas is a taut and action-packed sci-fi thriller about family, loss and the dangerous questions surrounding emerging scientific technologies.
description:
At a medical research facility in Puerto Rico, daring neuroscientist Will Foster (Keanu Reeves) is on the verge of successfully transferring human consciousness into a robot when his family is tragically killed in a car crash.

Not wanting to say goodbye to his wife (Alice Eve) and three children, Will recruits his colleague Ed (Thomas Middleditch) on an audacious mission to preserve their minds and transfer them into secretly-grown clone bodies…

Soon discovering that playing God has its downsides, Will battles against the clock and the physical laws of science themselves to resurrect his loving family.

When success appears to be within reach, Will finds himself pitted against a sinister government-controlled laboratory and a shady police task force who will stop at nothing to find the key to the incredible scientific breakthrough…

Offering a fresh take on the Frankenstein myth, Replicas is a taut and action-packed sci-fi thriller about family, loss and the dangerous questions surrounding emerging scientific technologies.

Directed by Jeffery Nachmanoff (The Day After Tomorrow), Replicas arrives on Digital Download from 22 April and Blu-ray & DVD from 29 April courtesy of Lionsgate UK.
